text: Did it ever happen to anyone that you create a module and then it's not available?

Hey everyone - I’ve been scouring the docs, and maybe I’m blind, but I have what is hopefully a simple question.

Is it possible to use a custom font with a HubSpot layout building template for Landing Pages?
Our goal is to allow our client to build these at will, rather than relying on our developers for a custom-coded template.
Are you referring to custom fonts as in things like Google Fonts or Typekit?
Custom as in a custom font not available in google fonts
Bariol is our clients’ brand font

For building in this manner, I would suggest looking into building a theme that would allow for the content editor to tweak settings and also make use of our dnd_areas for building building pages using drag and drop. You can always get a quick start by <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate|cloning our Boilerplate> and going from there.
They are switching from Elouqa (where we previously have built HTML landing pages from scratch with custom HTML & SCSS) - to HubSpot
So this would allow for a somewhat custom theme (use a non-google font etc.) but then allow part of the template. below the fold for example, to use the drag and drop functionality ?

Yep, exactly, you could use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli|CLI> to upload the files (including your TTF and WOFF) to your portal and then when using the themes, you can create multiple templates for them to use in the CMS.

I’d take a look at our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started|Quick Start Guide> and also our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-themes|Getting Started with Themes Guide> to help get familiar with working with local dev, CLI, and our CMS

> then allow part of the template. below the fold for example, to use the drag and drop functionality ?
For this type of scenario, you would just add the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags/dnd-areas|dnd_area >tags for the areas that you want folks to be able to use the drag and drop area in.
